item.description:
LOOK FOR A RED HELIUM BALLOON AT THE COMMONS  

I thought it would be fun to meet for a picnic at the Parkman Bandstand in Boston Commons and watch the production of Shakespear's "All's Well That Ends Well." "Shakespeare’s globe-trotting adventure story of how far one woman will go to win the heart of her beloved. Helena loves Bertram, but marriage is the last thing on Bertram’s mind. With boundless wit and tenacity, Helena pursues Bertram from Paris to Florence and through a maze of obstacles thrown at her by chance, circumstance, and her fiancé’s recalcitrance, finally emerging victorious."  I'll be camped out somewhere in front of the Parkman Bandstand at 6:00. Look for a red balloon. Bring blankets, chairs, umbrella (in case of rain), snacks and drinks (I don't think alcohol is allowed at the Commons).

There will also be more food options for sale at the Commons this year.  " Gourmet picnic baskets, fresh-baked cupcakes, premium sandwiches, cheesy pizza, all-natural smoothies and organic fare--there's something for just about everyone! Most items are under $7, with a portion of every purchase benefiting CSC."
